SENT.plain: The authors present the case of a hypertensive patient with a thrombosis of a saccular microaneurysm (SMA) and underlying cerebral (pontine) lacunae
This SMA lay at the junction between the main vessel and two small feeding arteries penetrating into the necrotic territory
Microhemorrhages were observed in and outside the aneurysmal wall
Very sinuous narrow channels of recanalization crossed the thrombosis between the upstream and downstream vessels
The anatomical relationship between the SMA and the lacunae has been histologically demonstrated
